intro: Psychotria pumila var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, short hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers with prominent yellow stamens, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
